# Minority Governments in the Literature

----

Pledge fulfillment in single-party majority vs. minority governments

- Single-party minority governments tend to keep similar proportions of promises as single-party majority governments<!-- for the same time frame-->

- Reasons why they fulfill many pledges

  1. The electoral platform as a contract

  2. Pressure from opposition parties

  3. Defending their performance in case of early election

----

- Reasons why they do not fulfill all pledges

  1. Some promises cannot be fulfilled

  2. Exogenous shocks

<!--
Présentation surtout descriptive et comparative aujourd'hui, pour établir les bases
-->

# Conclusion

----

- Mandate 2: several exogenous shocks & short mandate -> 48% broken pledges, 23% fully kept

- Mandate 3: Liberal--NDP Agreement, more stability despite crises
  - Already 80% promises kept, partially kept or in progress
  - Relatively high by historical standards for minority governments
  - But most of the 30% "in progress" & 16% "not yet rated" promises would be broken if the election was launched right now
